--- title: "Nonparametric tests and count data" --- ## Content - Models and tests for count data - Nonparametric tests ## Learning objectives At the end of the session, students should be capable of - Understanding the benefits and drawback of rank-based tests. - Performing tests for count data and correctly report their output. ## Readings - {{< fa book >}}[Chapter 12 *Categorical data analysis*](https://learningstatisticswithr.com/book/chisquare.html) of @Navarro:2019 - Chapters [12](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/12-nonparametric.html) and [13](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/13-count.html) of the course notes ## Slides

View all slides in new window Download PDF of all slides

``` ::: ::: ## Code - [R script](/content/MATH80667A-13-content.R) - [SPSS script](/content/MATH80667A-13-content.sps) :::{.callout-tip} **Fun fact**: If you type ? (or shift + /) while going through the slides, you can see a list of slide-specific commands. :::
